Contents

  • 1 National flags
  • 2 Government flags
  • 3 Historical flags
  • 4 State flags
  • 5 See also

National flags[edit]

Flag Date Use Description
1889–1960 1960–1968 1968–1992 1992–present National flag, state flag, state ensign, civil ensign and war ensign Is a blue disc depicting a starry sky spanned by a curved band inscribed with the national motto, within a yellow rhombus, on a green field.
Naval jack Rectangular flag (ratio 3:4) bearing 21 white stars on a dark blue field – a horizontal row of 13 and a vertical column of 9, orthogonally displayed.

Government flags[edit]

Flag Date Use Description
Presidential standard Dark green rectangle (ratio 2:3) holding the national coat of arms on its center.
Vice-presidential standard Yellow rectangle (ratio 2:3) with twenty-three blue stars disposed in a cross dividing the flag into four equal quadrants, with the coat of arms in the middle of the upper left quadrant.
Flag of Minister of State Rectangular (larger side once and a half times the lowest), the yellow color of the national flag, with twenty-one arranged in cross blue stars, five in each arm and one in the center, and the center of the upper left quad star of the coat of arms.

Historical flags[edit]

Flag Date Use Description
1645-1815 Flag of the Principality of Brazil The armillary sphere representing the Portuguese navigation on a white field; was the banner of the Princes of Brazil.
1815-1822 Flag of the United Kingdom of Portugal, Brazil and the Algarves The Coat of Arms of the union with the armillary sphere representing the Kingdom of Brazil and the Portuguese shield representing the Kingdom of Portugal and the Algarves, with a Royal Crown, on a white field.
1816-1822 Armorial flag of the Kingdom of Brazil inside the United Kingdom of Portugal, Brazil and the Algarves The armillary sphere, insignia of the Kingdom of Brazil on a blue field.
1822 Flag of the newly independent Kingdom of Brazil The Prince Royal's Personal Standard with a Royal Crown instead of an Imperial.
1822-1870 Flag of the Empire of Brazil The Imperial Coat of Arms, within a yellow rhombus representing the House of Habsburg, on a green field representing the House of Braganza.
1870-1889 Flag of the Empire of Brazil The Imperial Coat of Arms, within a yellow rhombus representing the House of Habsburg, on a green field representing the House of Braganza.
1889 Provisional flag of the Republic of the United States of Brazil between 15–19 November 1889 Thirteen horizontal green and yellow stripes; in the canton, 21 white stars on a blue field.
1889-1960 Is a blue disc depicting a starry sky spanned by a curved band inscribed with the national motto, within a yellow rhombus, on a green field in the 21 star.
1960-1968 Is a blue disc depicting a starry sky spanned by a curved band inscribed with the national motto, within a yellow rhombus, on a green field in the 22 star.
1968-1992 Is a blue disc depicting a starry sky spanned by a curved band inscribed with the national motto, within a yellow rhombus, on a green field in the 23 star.
